1.text: Man being born of woman is short of days and full of disquiet.

2.text: And as a flower he will come forth, and will be cut down: and he will flee as a shadow, and shall not stand.

3.text: Also upon this one didst thou open thine eyes? and wilt thou bring Me into judgment with thee?

4.text: For who shall give a clean thing from an unclean? Not one.

5.text: If his days are determined, the number of his months with thee; thou madest his limit; he shall not pass over.

6.text: Look away from him and be shall cease, till he shall delight as an hireling in his day.

7.text: For there is hope for a tree if it shall be cut down, and it shall yet revive, and its suckers shall not cease.

8.text: If its root shall grow old in the earth, and its trunk shall die in the dust.

9.text: From the smell of water it will break forth, and make foliage as a plant.

10.text: And man will die and be weak: and man will expire, and where is he?

11.text: The waters departed from the sea, and the river will be wasted and dried up;

12.text: And man lay down and he will not rise: till the heavens be no more they shall not awake and rise from their sleep.

13.text: Who will give thou wilt hide me in hades? wilt thou cover me till the turning away of thine anger? wilt thou set for me a limit, and wilt thou remember me?

14.text: If a man die, shall he live? All the days of my warfare I will wait till the coming of my change.

15.text: Thou shalt call and I will answer thee: thou wilt long for the work of thy hands.

16.text: For now thou wilt count my steps: wilt thou not watch over my sin?

17.text: My transgression is sealed up in a purse, and thou wilt patch upon mine iniquity.

18.text: And yet the mountain falling shill decay, and the rock shall be removed from its place.

19.text: The waters rubbed the stones: thou wilt overflow the flowings of the dust of the earth; and thou didst destroy the hope of man.

20.text: Thou wilt overpower him forever, and he will go away: changing his face, thou wilt send him away.

21.text: His sons will be honored and he knew not: they will be brought low, and he will not understand for them.

22.text: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul upon him shall mourn.
